SUMMARY: AscG, Arbutin-salicin-cellibiose, transcriptional regulator represses expression of a cryptic operon (ascFB) whose genes are involved in transport and utilization of Î²-glucoside sugars arbutin, salicin, and cellibiose. This operon is activated only when repressor is inactivated through interruption of gene by an insertion sequence [1630307]. AscG also regulates prpBC for propionate catabolism [19633077]. AscG is a GalR-type transcription factor and has a helix-turn-helix motif [1630307, 19633077]. AscG recognizes and binds consensus palindromic sequence TGAAACCGGTTTCA [19633077]. ascG gene is transcribed divergently from operon it regulates [1630307] ascG is paralogous to galR [19633077]. A high level of AscG is always present in wild-type Escherichia coli cells [19633077].
